pullRequest.body:
This adds some API lemmas for additive characters.
* Name change: `AddChar.primitiveCharFiniteField` to `AddChar.FiniteField.primitiveChar`

We also remove a porting note (`AddChar.PrimitiveAddChar` can be a structure again) and fix a typo in a lemma name from another recent PR.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Looks good to me, modulo some very minor pedantry.
I would suggest renaming this as `IsPrimitive.compMulHom` or similar, so we can dot-notate on it.

IIRC, the deprecation syntax isn't capable of looking inside the body of the `alias` declaration to find out what the new name is. So you get a better error message if you include the new name in the deprecation, as
```
@[deprecated FiniteField.primitiveChar (since := "2024-05-30")] alias primitiveCharFiniteField := FiniteField.primitiveChar
```
Then anyone using the old name will get explicitly told what the new name should be (& they can update it in one click in VSCode).
EDIT: It seems this isn't actually true, so please ignore this remark. (I think it may have been true with a previous version of the deprecation syntax, or maybe I just hallucinated it completely.)
This is the syntax that you get when you type "de" in VSCode and accept the first suggestion...
Looks like there's a missing `s` in `norm_eq_one_of_mem_rootOfUnity`, could you please fix it?

```suggestion
  simp only [mem_rootsOfUnity', Nat.toPNat'_coe, h, â†“reduceIte, IsUnit.unit_spec, â† map_nsmul_pow,
    nsmul_eq_mul, CharP.cast_eq_zero, zero_mul, map_zero_one]
```
I tried to replace `CharP.cast_eq_zero`by `Nat.cast_zero`, but here it is really necessary! :smile:

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add API for additive characters
